snippet: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, along with a growing number of economists, argue that there are tentative signs that adjustments are beginning to pay off.
abstract: Mario Draghi, president of the European Central Bank, joins growing number of economists who argue that, even though the euro zone still faces huge economic problems, there are tentative signs that two years of painful adjustment are beginning to pay off.
lead_paragraph: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, along with a growing number of economists, argue that there are tentative signs that adjustments are beginning to pay off.

headline.main: European Central Bank’s Leader Sees Progress in Tough Times for Euro Zone
headline.print_headline: European Central Bank’s Leader Sees Progress in Tough Times for Euro Zone
